awd_titl_txt: Spectroscopic Probes for Structural and Substitution Isomersin Alkali Cluster Beams
awd_abstract_narration: This research, part of the Experimental Physical Chemistry                      Program, utilizes spectroscopic techniques to probe for                         structural and substitution isomers in alkali cluster beams.                    The data obtained in these studies will further advance the                     field of gas-phase clusters where, so far, information on                       multiple sructural isomers among aggregates of one particular                   size is lacking.                                                                Near-infrared two photon ionization and ion depletion probes                    will be used to characterize excited states of microclusters,                   with the aim of identifying candidate species for isomer                        differentiation. The differentiation studies will make use of                   isomer specific optical bleaching followed by size specific                     detection of the resulting modified absorption.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
